data.title: Chibi Me, plus 90-Second Newbery: The Black Cauldron and Princess Academy
data.meta_description: I taught a sci-fi and fantasy writing class for gifted junior high schoolers at Northwestern University of the summer. I just received the above from one of my students, Caitlin―known as Courtine o…
data.text:
Sunday, August 18, 2024

I'm appearing at Fan Expo Chicago, doing the Battle of the Tropes! "Do you cheer for the Chosen One or do you prefer the Final Girl? Do you love an enemies-to-lover's story and search out only one bed situations? Join us as authors and literary influencers battle it out in a spirited debate to determine the supreme tropes. Your votes determine the winners of each round." With author Lori Brand (author of Bodies To Die For). At the Donald E. Stephens Convention Center (5555 N. River Road, Rosemont, IL) in Workshop (Room 7). 4-4:45 pm.

Wednesday, September 4, 2024

I'm doing a live recording of the Secrets of Story podcast with co-hosts Matt Bird and Betsy Bird, as a special event for the Society of Children's Book Writers and Illustrators (SCBWI)! At the Book Stall bookstore (811 Elm Street, Winnetka, IL.)

Saturday, September 28, 2024

I'm speaking on a panel and writing workshop called "Finding Horror in the Everyday" with other members of the Chicago-area chapter of the Horror Writers Association at the Glen Ellyn Public Library (400 Duane Street, Glen Ellyn, IL). 2-4 pm.

Saturday, October 12, 2024

I'm speaking on a panel called "Meet your Not-So-Scary Local Horror Author" with other members of the Chicago-area chapter of the Horror Writers Association at the Fox River Valley Public Library (555 Barrington Ave, East Dundee, IL). 3-4:30 pm. More details TBA.

Saturday, October 26, 2024

I'm a featured author at the Tomes Of Terror Horror Convention and Book Fair through Bobzbay Books in Bloomington, IL. "This annual free event offers authors, readers, local businesses, and horror fans from across the Midwest an opportunity to celebrate the darker side of literature together." 10 am - 4 pm. More details to come.

Friday, January 17, 2025

Deadline for submissions to the 14th annual 90-Second Newbery Film Festival.

Saturday, February 22, 2025

The OGDEN, UTAH screening of the 14th annual 90-Second Newbery Film Festival. Hosted by me and Keir Graff (author of The Tiny Mansion, Minerva Keene's Detective Club, and more). At the Treehouse Children's Museum (347 22nd Street). More details to come.

Sunday, March 9, 2025

The CHICAGO screening of the 14th annual 90-Second Newbery Film Festival. Hosted by me and Keir Graff (author of The Tiny Mansion, Minerva Keene's Detective Club, and more). At the Harold Washington Library Center (400 S State St.) in the Pritzker Auditorium. 2 pm. More details to come.

Monday, March 24, 2025

Special extended deadline for Texas entries to be shown at the May 3 San Antonio screening of the 90-Second Newbery Film Festival.

Saturday, April 5, 2025

The ROCHESTER, NY screening of the 14th annual 90-Second Newbery Film Festival. At the George Eastman Museum (900 East Ave) in the Dryden Theater. Hosted by me and the legendary Bruce Coville (author of My Teacher is an Alien and more). More details to come.

Saturday, April 12, 2025

The BOSTON screening of the 14th annual 90-Second Newbery Film Festival. At the Boston Public Library, in Rabb Hall at the Central Library in Copley Square (700 Boylston Street). More details to come.

Saturday, May 3, 2025

The SAN ANTONIO screening of the 14th annual 90-Second Newbery Film Festival. In the H-E-B Performance Hall at the Tobin Center for the Performing Arts (100 Auditorium Circle). Made possible by our partners at the Bexar County Digital Library Bibliotech and H-E-B Read 3. More details to come.
